comments.commentBody: If Obama is seriou about cutting spending and balancing the federal budget, he should at least make an effort to promote the Bowles-Simpson plan as a counter-proposal to the Congress's “Cut, Cap, Balance”.

comments.userDisplayName: Blue Deep in the Red States
comments.commentBody: We have seen Ancient Rome and it is US! The US House of Representatives is sadly a nasty three ring circus. Obama finally at the 11th hour mind you, made the case that being held hostage is no way to function. He is correct the Tea Party has intentionally caused paralysis and severe dysfunction to the federal government. Their intention is to destroy the country they see as one they now love to hate. The other two rings in the circus Obama discussed are those in his Whitehouse and the US Senate. The USA is on its steep descent out of a great power...very sad indeed.

President Obama & Congress: Get your heads out of the sand! What are they thinking? Why are no tax increases on the table? No one wants to raise taxes --the big 800-pound gorilla in the room. Most of us cannot forget that it was the Bush tax cuts in 2001 & 2003 for the wealthy that accounted for almost 1/2 the deficit. Add to that 1.2 trillion for both wars in Iraq and Afghanistan (a significant number in that it mirrors exactly the number that each party wants to cut now) and, presto, that's how we got to where we are today. It's a no-brainer; restore the Bush tax cuts on the wealthy and get out of Iraq & Afghanistan. Call out the fakirs who keep repeating that idiotic myth--"job-killing taxes" --while 15 million people are out of work and corporations are parking their trillions overseas rather than investing here at home.

Another point: we all pay into the government programs referred to as "entitlements" : Social Security and Medicare. We deserve the right to collect on that savings plan when we can no longer work. True "entitlements" were the hundreds of billions given out to the big banks, brokerage firms, and AIG when their house of cards collapsed in 2008. Yes, given out at ridiculously low rates. We don't need "shared sacrifice" as President Obama keeps repeating. What we really need is for those very same billionaires to "sacrifice" just a little bit and compensate the American taxpayer by paying a fair tax hike (how does 50% sound, Jeffrey Immelt, CEO of GE who paid zero tax last year?) That would be the right thing to do and a decent quid pro quo for the huge taxpayer bailout they received, particularly now that they are sitting on trillions of dollars in profits while Mr. Average American is struggling to pay his bills.
Did Boehner say "Cut, Cap, Balance" was bi-partisan?  Does he understand the definition of bi-partisan?  Having 5 democratic votes does not constitute a bi-partisan plan.

Speaker Boehner's power in the House is weak with Republicans and he can't get a balanced deal done(taxes + spending cuts)so he punted. President Obama seeing Boehner has no influence gave up the tax increase requirement as pointless cuz it wont pass and backed Reid's plan which doesn't have enough in spending cuts to satisfy the rating agencies from a downgrade. What Obama should do is hold firm on tax increases + spending cuts, use the 14th Amendment and to raise the debt ceiling and call the Tea Party's bluff. This approach is winning in every poll (tax increase + spending cuts)and he gets the debt ceiling raised.

Grand Bargain?!?...and Dems say it with a straight face.

Dems spend $Trillions in record time, with nothing to show, and now they're going to tell us about their Grand Bargain. They are not slick, they're just plain sleazy.
I'm thinking that we need an "American spring."
Boehner is a liar and Obama has not learned anything about dealing with the party that wants him to be a 1 term president.

Number 529, didn't you notice?  President Obama is more than willing to throw Medicare and Social Security under the bus.  Obama is no better than the Republicans, all politicians are selfish creatures not to be trusted.

so what else is new? this administration has been a crisis in and of itself from day one. if real leadership was available in the white house, this issue would have been resolved weeks ago. if only we had a real president with skills........

The party that lied the country into "war" and now doesn't want to pay for it is lecturing the we-must-pay-for-the-wars President, as well as the middle class and working poor, on fiscal responsibility?

Hideous.

God almighty. What happens when we don't get along, and can't compromise? This country was based on compromise???

Lol, ya know, Republicans aren't the only ones with guns to defend themselves....

I am appalled at the number of people who think tax increases will generate enough revenue to solve our problems. As for raising the debt limit, we borrow 40 cents out of every dollar we spend. And how is being allow to borrow more money, that we can't pay back, going to improve our situation? Our credit rating is going to be downgraded because we spend more than the take in. Our credit rating is going to be down graded even if the debt ceiling is raised.

Cutting is the answer, but the other solution is to grow out of this. Want to know how to grow out of this, cut taxes. Every time taxes have been cut, revenue to the Federal coffers has increased due to the growth of business and the tax revenue that generates. Every time taxes are raised the economy is suppressed leading to reduced money coming into the coffers.

Raising taxes is what took a normal cyclical down turn in the '20s and turned it into the Great Depression. We have no recovery at this time or anytime in the last 18 months, unless you actually believe the administration's claims. You know, those claims that if we didn't spend more money that we didn't have unemployment would exceed 8%! Oh, DTW, there is no such thing as a jobless recovery. That joke is right up there with the one about "shovel ready projects." You know, the one Obama laughed about as the gave us the punch line, "There are no such things," a couple of months ago!

There is another way out of this mess that Obama has put us in, inflate our way out. Yep, that'll work just fine for the government, and all we'll have to do is take a wheelbarrow full of paper money, you know, the stuff Obama prints willy-nilly, to the grocery store to buy a loaf of bread.

You know, Greece thinks/expects it'll be bailed out by the EU. Who the heck will bail us out? Ain't gonna happen. We get ourselves out of it, once Obama gets out of the way.
Obama should bypass Congress, invoke the 14th and pay for the debt Congress has already incurred.
Lovely speech by Mr. Obama. Lincolnesque.
The Tea Party freshmen make me feel sick to my stomach.

In my very humble opinion, the Republicans are doing everything they can to try and damage the economy enough to make President Obama a one term president.  At the same time, they are also damaging ordinary people.  We should not be electing representatives who do not represent the best interests of our country and its citizens. If they cannot look beyond themselves or their egos, they are not fit to hold office.
Why dont you people just call it taxes instead of revenue.  He has no plan, just wants to spend like he has been doing.  It is time to stop it all

Given that Boehner has offered nearly a trillion dollars in revenue increases, why do so many people argue that the Republicans refuse to give up a nickle in revenue increases, and that Republicans do not intend to compromise?  Could it be the media's constant barrage of false claims that only Democrats are willing to compromise?  That's what it looks from what I read in the Times and virtually every other MSM outlet.

At this point, I am just a passenger on this airplane.

I hope the pilots are awake and sober and know how to land this thing.
When they rape your minds, you'll really be upset. Don't they seem like the type that would?

Boehner's speech was better. More specific, down-to-earth, of-the-people, better sound bites, appealed to "common sense" about spending. It was also a masterfully cynical piece of spin and a childish description of macro economics. The largest economy in the world is NOTHING like a small business in Ohio. Not at all. We went through this once before, in 1937, when Congress voted to cut spending in the middle of a terrible depression.

It took the biggest round of deficit spending in the history of humankind to pull us out of THAT one.

It was called World War II. Setting aside the most horrific destruction of humanity in the history of humankind, that round of stimulus led to the best 30 or 40 years of our lives, economically speaking.

If 100 million regular, non-zillionaire Americans have 401ks or other investments that have just now ALMOST clawed back  close to 2008 levels, and a financial crisis chomps them down another 25%, how does saving tax loopholes for the 250K + earners while we ALL lose a substantial part of our savings help the American economy, not to mention "average" voters?  Huh, House hard-liners?  You will have some 'splainin to do to us, and we won't forget.

It's going to be my sweet pleasure to notify my member of Congress, Rep. Ted Poe of Texas, that my husband is busy shopping the local hardware stores for a good quality pitchfork.
If he votes as we believe he's likely to and this country defaults on its debt, we are going to picket his offices and we urge all who find their Social Security, veterans' benefits, etc., "lost" in the mail, to assure Mr. Poe that he just THOUGHT Texas was under a heat wave.
He will find out what "Hot" really means.
This artificially induced exercise is a result of the complete abandonment of Congress' responsibility to take care of the country.
They can't blame President Obama on this one.
THEY are to blame.
As a lifelong Republican, I weep.  Boehner just continues to go downhill, and the Party has become a joke.  Go O.
